DOC.brief_summary: Recent study show hyperbaric oxygen therapy ( HBOT ) induce angiogenesis improve impair organ function . HBOT also recently suggest possible therapy ED due surgical injury . However , effect HBOT non-surgical related ED investigate date . The objective study assess effect HBOT patient ED mean sexual function questionnaire novel image technique .
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective analysis men , age 18 year old , clinical diagnosis erectile dysfunction , report decrease weakened nocturnal penile tumescence six month duration longer . Patients treat The treatment comprise 40 daily hyperbaric session , 5 day week , multiplace hyperbaric chamber ( HAUX-Life-Support GmbH ) . Each session consist 90 minute exposure 100 % oxygen 2 ATA 5 minute air break every 30 minute 1 meter per minute compression decompression . Sexual function Efficacy treatment assess use International Index Erectile Function ( IIEF ) questionnaire fill patient baseline within 2 week last HBOT session . In addition , assess efficacy global efficacy question ( GEQ ) ( `` Did treatment improve erection ? `` ) , response yes . Six patient underwent two MRI scan 1-2 week prior HBOT . Imaging conduct use 3Tesla system ( MAGNETOM Skyra , Siemens Medical Solutions , , Germany ) . The MRI protocol include anatomic T1 T2 sequence DCE . The MRI DCE sequence parameter detail supplementary section .
DOC.criteria: age 18 year old clinical diagnosis erectile dysfunction reporting decrease weakened nocturnal penile tumescence six month duration longer penile anatomical defect , active history malignancy include prostate cancer spinal cord injury major psychiatric disorder uncontrolled treatment claustrophobia chronic lung disease chronic middle ear sinus disease .
